summary: A bizarre, satirical letter from a fictional character named Esther Cohen-Tizer-Epstein, claiming to be a successor to the Jeffrey Epstein Foundation and offering sexual services. It references Epstein, his associates, and locations in a mocking, exaggerated style. The document appears to be a hoax or parody.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the founder of the Jeffrey Epstein Foundation, a neighbor in New Mexico, and the alleged common law husband of the letter's author. Described as tall, handsome, rich, and magnetic.

persons.name: Esther Cohen-Tizer-Epstein
persons.context: The fictional author of the letter who claims to run 'The Bowls School of Nourishment and Healing' as successor to the Jeffrey Epstein Foundation. She describes a personal history involving sexual services and recruitment.

persons.name: Peter "JonBenet" Klein-Tizer-Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the common law husband of the author, Esther.

persons.name: Chad
persons.context: Mentioned as a friend of Peter Klein-Tizer-Epstein.

persons.name: Yo Tizer
persons.context: Described as 'Lord, Savior, and common law husband' of the author, and the gum of the cult 'Divine Madness' or 'The Family'.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the VIPs Jeffrey Epstein introduced the author's daughters to.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the VIPs Jeffrey Epstein introduced the author's daughters to.

persons.name: President Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the VIPs Jeffrey Epstein introduced the author's daughters to.

persons.name: Ghislaine
persons.context: Given a 'quick thank you' at the end of the letter.

connections.description: The author claims Jeffrey Epstein became her new common law husband after she was sent as an ambassador from the Divine Madness cult.
The author describes Yo Tizer as her Lord, Savior, and former common law husband, for whom she performed 'Great Gift Sessions'.
Epstein is described as introducing the author's daughters to VIPs including Alan Dershowitz.
Epstein is described as introducing the author's daughters to VIPs including Prince Andrew.
Epstein is described as introducing the author's daughters to VIPs including President Clinton.
The author gives a 'quick thank you' to Ghislaine at the end of the letter.

events.title: Family 'Stress Release Sessions' in Atlanta
events.description: The author describes her mother offering 'Stress Release Sessions' to husbands in an alley, while her father gave abortions.

events.title: Expansion to New Mexico Ranch
events.description: The Divine Madness cult expanded to a ranch in Reserve, New Mexico, making them neighbors to Jeffrey Epstein at Zorro Ranch.

events.title: Fertility Ritual on Little St. James Island
events.description: The author describes using a turkey baster in a fertility ritual with Epstein's semen to conceive her youngest daughter.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
keyFacts: The document is a satirical letter from a fictional character claiming to be Esther Cohen-Tizer-Epstein, a successor to the Jeffrey Epstein Foundation.
It mockingly describes a history of sexual services, recruitment of young women, and association with the cult 'Divine Madness'.
The letter references real figures like Jeffrey Epstein, Alan Dershowitz, Prince Andrew, and President Clinton in a parody context.
It mentions Epstein properties like Zorro Ranch and Little St. James Island.
The author claims to receive USPS Money Orders from Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center to keep quiet.
